greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Exponent of 2 in 9^n - 1.
comment: The exponent of 2 in the factorization of Fibonacci(6n). - _T. D. Noe_, Mar 14 2014
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
T. Lengyel, The order of the Fibonacci and Lucas numbers, Fib. Quart. 33 (1995), 234-239.
formula: a((2*n-1)*2^p) = p + 3, p >= 0. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Feb 08 2013
a(n) = 2*tau(4*n)/(tau(4*n) - tau(n)), where tau(n) = A000005(n). - _Peter Bala_, Jan 06 2021
example: For n = 2, we see that -1 + 3^4 = 80 = 2^4 * 5 so a(2) = 4.
maple: nmax:=70: for p from 0 to ceil(simplify(log[2](nmax))) do for n from 1 to ceil(nmax/(p+2)) do a((2*n-1)*2^p) := p+3: od: od: seq(a(n), n=1..nmax); # _Johannes W. Meijer_, Feb 08 2013
results.author: _Labos Elemer_ and _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 19 2004
ext: More terms from _T. D. Noe_, Mar 14 2014
